name: Novotel Southampton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here in "superior" for one night on 9/10/09 before going on cruise, booked and paid for room well in advance got great deal, room was excellent, breakfast included which was excellent, had evening meal in their restaurant which was supberb for the price.
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would recommend this hotel and would certainly stay again.
reviews.title: Resonable Place to Stay before your Cruise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sailed on the Queen Mary 2 from Southampton to New York in October 2009. Pre-cruise hotel was the Novotel by my own choice. About three blocks to the bus station (we took the National Express from Heathrow to Southampton). Just blocks away from the Mayflower dock. Taxi to the dock was about 6 pounds. Easy walking distance to a large mall with restaurants and shops. Tesco, Aldi, McDonalds, TGI's all within a 5 minute walk. Comfortable rooms although a bit dated. The lobby was under renovation. Bar and restaurant on site.
reviews.title: Stay here? No thank you.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Took a chance on this hotel reading the reviews. The lobby looks nice. Our room was clean but shabby. Maid service was intermitent. The front desk missed an important wake up call and didn't even apologize. Phone calls and internet are super expensive and don't work well so you pay even more. In fact, the phone calls are charged at a rate higher than their notification. You are charged for breakfast, even if you didn't have it and you need to call and ask to have it removed from your bill. The air conditioning/heating don't work. You can open the window but the loud road noise will keep you awake at night. We had scaffolding outside our window. Made us feel unsecure. Even though it was a non-smoking room, the ventilation system carries the smell up to your room. The front desk seems to have an attitude and we did not feel welcome. (The manager was no where to be found)
reviews.title: Novotel Southampton - not a good value and potentially hazardous to your health.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The shower was funky as described in another post, but the spray was strong and lots of hot water.
reviews.title: Perfect pre-cruise hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: OK. Reception area and restaurant very well done and the staff friendly and helpful. the location is convenient being opposite the station, close to the shops and the ships but nothing special as an hotel. For what was paid it represented very poor value for money but if you can get it at a reasonable price it would be acceptable. The room was of a good size, I liked the fridge/minibar as that was useful to put my own stuff in and the breakfast was quite nice, well presented and for those that cannot do without tv at breakfast, single booths with inbuilt tv's.
reviews.title: Very average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a place that I would not rush back to, I would prefer somewhere else that represented better value for money such as the Jury's hotel.
reviews.title: Ideal location and great value for pre cruise stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: We were in room 105. The room was large, had the bonus of a comfortable settee, ironing board and iron, limited mini bar, beverage tray, safe and hairdryer. The staff happily gave us more coffee sachets on request.
reviews.title: Highly recommended.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: The windows could only be opened a limited amount, as they opened onto a flat roof but the room was still cool enough, windows away from the flat roof opened fully. With the windows open we could hear a dull, low noise of some traffic but not enough to stop you sleeping and with the windows shut there was no noise whatsoever. The room had air conditioning.
reviews.title: OK for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The room and fixture and fittings were in very good condition, the bathroom and seperate loo were all very clean and fresh. The water was always hot and the taps very easy to control the temperature.
reviews.title: Cruise Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Another comfortable stay at a Novotel. When travelling with children, it really is hard to do better than the Novotels.
reviews.title: Everything we needed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't tell the children there was a pool, but there is! Room comfortable, with sufficient space 2+2. The children slept on the double sofa bed - which is actually 2 full sized, rather comfortable single beds.
reviews.title: California travelers say 'It's Worth the money!'

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Shower curtain arrangement a bid awkward, and anyone with balance difficulties may find it hard to step in and out without assistance.
reviews.title: very modern, very proffesional staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: We ate dinner in the restaurant, lovely food and good service. They even have some cubicles for single dinners with television sets.
reviews.title: Excellent value for reasonable price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Plenty of parking space available, if staying in the hotel it is a minimal charge. Fast food restaurants, Tesco home, and Toys r Us are in the same area. Very convenient to the docks.
reviews.title: couldnt believed my eyes, it made my weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used this hotel before going on a cruise. Arriving on a Saturday we were a bit surprised to find the restaurant had a very limited menu based on a carvery/ buffet. It was adequate but only that. The bar was fine, pleasant staff, although they ran out of glasses at one point! This could have been because a wedding reception was taking place in the function room. Rooms clean and quiet - we had booked an Executive room which was quite large and well equipped - nice coffee machine. Decor was "interesting" in the lounge - very modern and bright. Good breakfast.
reviews.title: Ok for one night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009
reviews.text: 1.The female Staff who checked me out had a really bad attitude, very unfriendly. I cannot be sure for whatever reason it was, but I certainly hope it was not because I was of a different nationality, but certainly it made me feel that way. 2. I call reception to tell them I have no heat in the room and reception said they would ask an engineer to attend to it. 6 hours after I still had no heat. I'm not sure if anyone even checked if there was a problem. I then walked DOWN to reception to tell the male staff about the problem. He asked me to turn the knob. I hope he doesn't think everyone is a moron, or perhaps I looked like one. Perhaps he could have asked me to just stare and the problem will go away ?? This male staff even WROTE on a little piece of paper of my room number and the problem, but after a few hours, I still had no heat. I called reception again and told a second male staff that was the THIRD time I am asking to fix the heat. He came to the room to confirm no heat. He was helpful to ACTUALLY CAME BACK with a helper. Apparently one had to TAKE DOWN the vent cover and RESTART the heat by putting your hand INSIDE the hole of the vent enclosing to touch a knob. The location of the vent is near the ceiling and I would not be able to reach anyway. but this male staff was in any case very helpful to me. All in all, a very unfriendly stay.
reviews.title: very unfriendly service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is overpriced and very noisy!!! We were woken by nosy neighbours at 6am each morning and at 4am from people coming back drunk, and all the doors slam shut when they close. I tried calling reception to complain but no answer! The toilet was horrible, all pebble-dashed, looked like an outdoor one, and it had freezing cold tiles. The heating was broken and the bed was like a camp bed. If you sat at the top end, the bottom end flicked up. Not impressed at all. I paid a lot of money for a superior room and to be honest I will go back to the Premier Inn for my next visit. Swimming pool was also being refurbished, which we didnt get told about until arrival.
reviews.title: Not Impressed, Premier Inn is far better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: The staff are really friendly and professional, the rooms are ok, some are in need of updating though
reviews.title: Pleasant hotel, good staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed with some clients who were visiting my company in Southampton from Italy and choose the Novotel as it was one of the closest hotels from my office. I was very pleasantly surprised by the great service and friendly staff. My clients were very impressed by the standard of the hotel. Rooms are a good size and comfortable, restaurant good value for money.
reviews.title: Great Service & Friendly Staff

description: The Novotel Southampton is located in the centre of Southampton. Located Opposite West Quay shopping centre and close to the Cruise terminals, Our hotel offers complimentry Wireless throught the Hotel. Visit the nearby National Motor Museum, the New Forest national park and the Cathedral City of Winchester then relax and enjoy our restaurant, room service, bar, indoor heated swimming pool, gym and sauna. Onsite pay parking.
